circumstances: During a night approach to Youngstown Airport while on a cargo flight from Chicago, both engines stopped simultaneously. The airplane lost height, struck trees then crashed in a wooded area. The aircraft was destroyed and the pilot, sole on board, was killed.
probable_cause:
Double engine failure on approach caused by a mismanagement of fuel on part of the pilot-in-command. The following factors were reported: 
- Fuel starvation, 
- The fuel selector was positioned between tanks, 
- Failure of both engines, 
- Both fuel selectors not fully open.
